talk.author: did:plc:iyee76eav46mcevpzwxtgpnc
talk.utter:
Nobody's suggesting you don't have that right. And fwiw I'm having a hard time navigating this too, I've responded to people in my own life in ways I'm not sure were for the best.

But we all have to decide for ourselves is most important - being right or getting free.

talk.author: did:plc:iyee76eav46mcevpzwxtgpnc
talk.utter: OP's argument wasn't that we don't have the right to express our anger, but that anger expressed in certain ways or contexts is counterproductive to our political goals. And IDK if that's right or not but I think it might be. Not that many people find vindictiveness attractive.

talk.author: did:plc:ox6jpqkkrh32dqzbstimz465
talk.utter: 76.8 million or so people found it attractive earlier this month.

talk.author: did:plc:iyee76eav46mcevpzwxtgpnc
talk.utter: I get where you're coming from but I don't think that's an accurate read on the situation. There are people who vote for Trump because of who he is and there are others despite who he is. Both are incomprehensible to me, but
